article: Every morning, Catherine takes exercise around some gardens in our neighborhood. One morning, she was walking _ than usual, and it was still dark. As she was walking,a cyclist came up to her, _ her handbag and sped off. She ran after him shouting "thief, thief". A man further ahead must have _ her or seen what had happened. He was washing a car with a bucket of _ near him. He took the bucket and poured it onto the cyclist. The cyclist drove off the street and fell off his bike. Some other people rushed over. My friend Catherine was47 _ that the people would beat him. She begged them not to _ him. She asked the boy _ he did this to her. He _ that he was the son of a _ and that this year their crops had _ . He said that the money lenders would beat up his father and hurt his _ if he didn't pay on time. He said that he was hopeless and didn't know what else to do. He was very _ . Catherine was _ moved by his story. She looked into the boy's eyes and then took out some _ from her handbag and gave it to him. She told him that stealing was _ and that he shouldn't do it again. He said he would follow her _ . He told her that he was in fact well brought up and that he had made a terrible _ . The boy left thankfully. Catherine sincerely _ that this would be the last time that the boy tried to steal something.
